page.title: 10A Sunday With Jeremy.
page.content: On Sundays my family always tries to stay in bed for some of the morning, usually until ten o'clock. When we do wake up we sometimes have a fried breakfast of bacon, fried bread, eggs and tomatoes. After breakfast my mum washes up the plates while my dad cleans the car or cuts the grass. I clean my bicycle, tidy my room, play records or cassettes, just play in my room or go out to play with my friends. If nobody is about in the village I go to Marsh Gibbon, another village three kilometres away. I have a special friend there, and another who lives about a kilometre from Marsh Gibbon. At about midday my mum starts to get the dinner ready. A typical Sunday dinner for my family is chicken soup, chicken legs, roast potatoes & peas.
